alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 29 at 5:22AM AKST until January 29 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility and very cold wind chills. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches through Monday afternoon. North winds gusting to 40 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Very cold wind chills to 50 below. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp. * WHEN...Until 3 PM AKST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. Large snow drifts will form. Wind chills to 50 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow, blowing snow, gusty north winds and cold wind chills will continue this morning. This will cause cause low visibility in blowing snow and heavy drifting snow this morning. North winds and blowing snow are expected to decrease late this morning, but heavy snow will continue into this afternoon and taper off late this afternoon. by
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp
